column1: full outswinger just outside off, driven off the toe-end, past the bowler
short of a length and wide outside off, slight shape in. But not enough to make him play
length ball wide outside off, left alone

there's a sound but no appeals. Full and just outside off. Looks like this goes straight on off the pitch after coming in. Gayle wants to drive for that trajectory and is beaten. Slammed the bat into the turf, it appears
appeal for lbw, turned down. Length ball swinging in from middle stump as he looks to defend. Slams him in front of leg
inswinger from a length, jabbed to mid-on with the angle
short of a length and climbing away from off stump. Hangs the bat out and is beaten on the outside edge
length ball wide outside off, zips past the outside edge as he swishes at this
short of a length in the corridor, 148kph, left alone for the angle
off the inside edge but sprints to the square leg boundary. Length ball and he backs away and has a swing at this. Thick inside edge
short and in the corridor, defended to point's right
length ball wide outside off, left alone
middles this one. Short of a length on middle stump, half a stride forward before swinging his arms across the line of this and getting it past midwicket
clears the long-on boundary. That looked like it was off the low part of the bat. Yes, it was. Length ball wide outside off and he dragged it across, but it went high and certainly had enough power
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man's left
short and in at off stump. Allows it to come on and opens the face to get it to third man
length ball just outside off, solidly behind the line to punch to extra cover
thick edge safely down to third man. Looks to punch through cover off the back foot and is caught slightly inside the line
length on off stump, punched on the rise to mid-off
length and in at off stump, sliced on the rise to point
length outside off, too early on the drive. Wants to go through cover on the rise, but this ends up at midwicket off the inside half

did that carry? No, falls short of Moeen at mid-off. Length outside off, tries to punch this over the infield on the up, but it's come off the toe-end and dipped as the fielder slides to his right to get his body behind it
bouncer across the corridor, 146kph. Backs away and shapes to pull. But decides to let it go
lifts it over mid-on to take four. This was short and at the body. Didn't have room, but the hands were sufficiently under this as he lifted it on the rise
full and down leg side, shifts his weight into the off side to make room and clips this behind square on the leg side. Fine leg is in, so no one stopping this

checks his shot but he's safe and this is past mid-on's dive. Overpitched on leg stump and he wanted to drive. Once again, he's through it early and withdraws the bottom hand so it doesn't chip up to that fielder. He succeeds
length on middle stump, driven on the up, off the toe-end, to mid-on
short of a length and into the pads. Poked into the leg side with soft hands
length on leg stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot

dropped at extra cover by a diving AB de Villiers. Tough chance. Once again Rahul doesn't connect on the drive. Happened a few times that his attempts have come off the toe-end. Is this pitch slower than it looks? This is at a length outside off, he wants to drive wide of mid-off. It lobs gently in that direction and AB's dive to the right is in vain
short of a length just outside off, backs away and hammers it, flat-batted, over mid-off
gets it over long-on. There's a plan there, but Gayle has beaten it. Just. Short and into his body. He slices it with an attempted pull. Stoinis is back there, but he watches it clear the fence

through the covers. Oh boy, looks like another long night for Siraj. Looks nervous already - third type of ball already. This is a slower one. It's short of a length and gives him time to back away and slap it
beats the edge. Length ball across the corridor. Pokes at it, beaten
buh bye! The plan is not working. Siraj is not getting the short balls to rise enough. Gayle picks this one from waist height and deposits it 94 metres into the leg side with a pull
past short fine. Length on leg stump, step into the leg side and whipped between keeper and that fielder
shot! Sends the ball sailing straight to welcome RCB's best bowler. Full on off, gets the front leg out, holds his shape, launches it straight with the full face offered

gets him! Chahal, calm, calculated. Doesn't even celebrate the wicket beyond just pumping his fist. Length ball, dipping at an off stump line. Rahul steps out, is beaten in flight, and loses his shape this time. Spins past his edge and he's stumped
length on leg stump, looks to push at it, thick inside edge towards long leg
length on leg stump, pushes at it, deflected fine off the pad
length on middle stump, defended down the pitch
slider, short of a length at off stump. Defended off the back foot

falls short of AB who sprints in from deep midwicket, puts in a slide, and does superbly to push the ball back into play on the half-volley with his right. Dropped short from Moeen, an aerial pull from Mayank
short of a length in the corridor, sticks in the pitch a little and Gayle has to check his poke into the covers
length outside off, tapped on the rise to extra cover
length outside off, steps out and looks to drive straight. Comes off the toe-end, back down the pitch
neatly tucked away. Full on middle stump, gets low with the front foot across the stumps and paddles it to the fine leg boundary
diving AB again, pulls this back in for deep square. Short ball at middle stump, pulled between those two fielders. It's a big square boundary here
short of a length on leg stump, gets on the back foot and flicks to deep square to bring up his fifty
length on off stump, gets forward and pushes into the covers
length on leg stump, nudged to short fine's right off the front foot

stunning shot over extra cover! Tossed up wide outside off, reaches out and whips his wrists firmly at this to get it over extra cover - and a long way! I can only think of Kohli when I think of who else could have executed that

and Chahal brings his own class in response! Superb, superb ball. The batsman doesn't know what he's just been dealt. Length ball, dipping into a short of a length on a middle stump line, squares him up completely and takes the top of off stump. Mayank is on the back foot looking to close the face on this and he is dumbfounded. Superb, just superb from Chahal. Two wickets immediately after being hit for sixes. There's a reason he's the best legspinner in limited-overs cricket right now
length, flat and sliding into middle. Defended down the pitch on the front foot
length, off stump, pushed into the covers
length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
length and in at middle, pushed down the pitch off the back foot
length ball sliding past the pad on the leg side
length at leg stump, tapped into the leg side
length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length on off stump, driven on the front foot to long-off
length ball, strays towards the pads, and he flicks this away towards deep midwicket, and pinches two
flatter, towards the pads, and he flicks this, but gets it down to short fine leg
length, down the leg side, and will be called wide as it turns further down leg
length, on off stump, and he punches this down to long off
tossed up, down leg side, and he looks for the sweep. Given as runs as it goes down the leg side and runs away to fine leg
flighted, and he punches this down towards long on
length ball from around the stumps, comes back into him, and he defends this
length ball, he punches this to covers
pulls out the reverse sweep to a length ball outside off, but plays it straight to short third man
flatter, outside off, and he drives it back to the bowler
length, and he goes back and punches this away towards point to pick up a single
length, and he goes back and punches a straight ball towards long on
flighted, and he swings this across the line towards deep midwicket. Just a single off this
length ball, jags back into him, and he runs it down to third man
slower ball, on off stump, and he runs it towards point
length, angles across him, he clears his front leg out of the way and whacks this straight down towards long off
full ball, on off stump, and he punches this hard, but AB de Villiers dives away to his right at cover and stops this. Top effort
length ball, and he has ramped this down to fine leg. For six! It was delivered at 143kph, and he just uses the pace of the ball to turn it over where long stop might have been
GONE THIS TIME! Sharp, short ball in response, and Khan looks to swing this away, but nicks it on the way through to Patel. Catches a bit of glove, and Patel takes a good catch away to his left
length, and he goes back and punches this towards deep midwicket
fuller ball, and he presses forward and whips this away towards deep midwicket
length, towards the pads, and he punches this towards deep midwicket again
length, and he goes back to cut it. It's too close, and he drops it back towards the bowler

Moeen gets his man! The pressure builds on Curran, and he tries a reverse sweep to a straight ball, more or less. Misses completely, and is hit on his thigh pad in front of his stumps. Given out, and Gayle advises his young partner to keep walking
length, and he drives it down towards wide long on
length, and he plays an uppish drive, just past Kohli at cover
length, and he plays it away towards square leg
fuller ball, and he drives this off leg stump towards long on
length, down the leg side, and Gayle gets it down to fine leg with a glance. Would have been wide had he left this, but he'll take the four runs on offer
length, turns into him from outside off, and he punches this down to long off
fuller ball, towards leg stump, and he looks to drive this to long off, but Chahal fields
short ball, lifting into Gayle as he moves away and tries to create some room for himself. That was brisk, as it seems to brush a bit of his shirt and go through to Patel
short ball, and he scoops this one towards square leg. It evades the man at square leg, and also doesn't carry to long leg. Good bowling again
short, wide and he cuts this, but there's deep backward point in place for Mandeep
short, and he goes for a swing across the line. Misses it altogether. Good ball yet again!
short, and outside off, and he was looking to back away towards leg. In the end, he cracks it hard towards the ground and gets it down towards extra cover
short, wide, and he cuts this one. Negi at point makes a half-stop, but cannot prevent two runs
slower ball, pitched up, and he swings, and gets an inside edge that narrowly goes past the leg stump. Trickles down towards short fine leg
length, coming back into him, and he whips this towards midwicket
short, and he has had a go at this. Swung this over backward square leg, and it has travelled some 20 rows back!
yorker, and he digs it out and gets it towards wide long on
length, outside off, and he cracks a square drive, but gets it to backward point
full again, and he drills this back down the ground. Virat Kohli fields it well at long on and keeps the scoring down to just one
tries a slower ball, across the batsman, and it's called a wide. Seemed to stay within the tramlines, but called against him
slower ball, full and angles across Gayle again. He leaves this one, just like the previous one, but this time there's no wide called
short, and he goes back and slaps this one down the pitch. Takes a deflection off non-striker Mandeep and goes towards cover
full ball, and he looks to drop-kick this towards midwicket. An inside edge on to his pads, and there's a stifled appeal from Saini. More importantly, a dot ball!
short, and he has swung this away towards deep midwicket, and AB de Villiers puts in a dive, but cannot stop it. Good work, running around from backward square leg, but just couldn't get the job done
length, a shape of swing in, and beats him for pace too. Mandeep looks to swing this towards cover, but misses out on contact. Delivered at 141kph
short, and he has gone for the pull again. It lands in empty spaces close to the deep midwicket. The ball stops enough and allows de Villiers to get to it
full ball, and he has swung this towards deep midwicket. There's a fielder in that region, but he has placed it to the right, more in the region of wide long on. One bounce, four!
full ball, and he biffs this away towards AB de Villiers at deep midwicket. Goes to him after bouncing
full ball, but down the leg side. Mandeep was looking for the flick, but missed on contact. Called a wide
yorker, and he digs this out towards extra cover
full ball, and he has driven this towards long on. Kohli has dropped this, diving forward. Wow! At this rate, RCB won't be catching a cold anytime soon
short ball, and he drives this away towards deep midwicket
full ball, but down the leg side. Gayle watches it through to Patel. Yadav will have to bowl this one again...
full again, and this time he has gone a few rows into stands behind deep midwicket
length, and he has pulled this away towards deep midwicket. Brings Gayle back on strike
length, and he has pulled this, off the inside of the bat, towards backward square leg. Just a single!
length, on the stumps, and he hammers it away towards deep midwicket
full, wide, and he slashes this over point. One bounce to the backward point fence!
full, wide, and he misses! That was quick, and within the tramlines, and didn't give any space for Gayle to get under it. Tried to thwack it down the ground, but missed

he finishes at 99 not out! Near-perfect execution of the wide yorker from Siraj, but Gayle gets some bat on it and sends it flying towards backward point. It bounces on the way, though, and Gayle walks off with a wry grin. Well batted, boss!
driven through cover. Nicely done. Shape for Curran, full and away from him, wide outisde off. Opens the face and gets it past extra cover
length and in at leg stump, flicked to fine leg
length and pushed across outside off, defended to point, away from the body
falls short of mid-on. Length on middle stump, angled in. Looks to flick and gets it off the high part of the bat. We saw this happen to Rahul in the first innings, the ball not coming on
length in the corridor, dropped into the off side with soft hands
length on off stump, defended to point on the front foot
shot! Nicely onto the bat this time and Kohli brings out the signature straight drive. Full and just outside off. Gets his weight into it and beats Ashwin's dive to the right at mid-off
he's away! Nice wristwork. Length at a middle and off line. Leans in and clips it in front of square. Shami under pressure straight away. Lovely attacking batting
length on middle stump, pushed to deep square off the inside half of the bat
full on middle stump, plants his front leg out and slugs across the line. Gets it past midwicket and it sprints away
length outside off, looks to drive on the up, sliced towards point who misfields
short of a length on off stump, opens the face and runs it down to third man
to mid-off's left this time. Some sublime batting so far from Kohli. It's a slow pitch and he's just driven Curran on the up, with a big stride, to beat Ashwin
slower ball, short of a length just outside off. Chopped to point
length just outside off, plants the front leg across and flicks to deep square's left to steal a second
length at off stump, closes the face too early on the flick and gets a leading edge to mid-off's right
forces it past the bowler and beats mid-off as well. Overpitched just outside off, looks to go hard at this, slightly turned bat, but enough connection on that
lifted over short fine! Lovely placement. Short of a length at off stump, walks into the off side a tad and just ramps this over the fielder there
full on middle stump, flicked to long-on
full on middle stump, flicked to mid-on's left
drilled past the bowler! Full outside off, gets to the pitch and just whips his wrists at this! So quick. Ashwin can barely get down as this races past the stumps
length on leg stump, clipped towards deep midwicket

taken at long-off! Tossed up outside off, steps out and is not to the pitch of this. Closes the face on this and gets a leading edge that's taken easily. This is good bowling from Ashwin. Went around the wicket and slowed it right down
length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left
length and just outside off. Dropped to point's left off the inside half

past mid-off. Probably not the ideal connection on it, but there's bat speed on this sufficient to get it past the infield. The back foot punch is slightly off the inside part of the bat, but well wide of Ashwin
yorker, 14k7kph, at off stump. Tapped into the off side off the toe-end
runs it to the third man boundary. Crafty. Length in the corridor, allows it to skid on and opens the face late to get it through where third slip would have been
full on middle stump, driven back to the bowler off the toe-end
length on off stump, punched firmly back at the bowler, who parries it to mid-off's left
short and just outside off, cut straight to point
length just outside off, driven on the rise to long-off
nearly drags on a filthy short ball! Short and very very wide outside off. Looks to pull and gets an inside edge that smashes into his pads and trickles past leg stump
short and wide, reaches out this time and goes with the turn. Gets a nice little swing at this and gets it between point and backward point

oh what a shot! Short of a length slider outside off. He shuffles and punches it wide of mid-on off the back foot. Deep midwicket sprints to his left and puts in a dive. Gets a hand on it but is not able to arrest his momentum. Pushes it into the boundary at long-on
full on off stump, pushed into the covers
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
checks the pull. Short outside off, might have rolled his fingers on this. Chipped safely into the vacant midwicket region
length and in at leg stump, flicked to deep square
inside edge onto boot. Slower ball, short and wide. AB swishes at it away from his body
overpitched on leg stump, flicked to long-on's right
slapped over extra cover. Slower short ball again. KohliAB waits on it and plays close to the body. On the back foot, reaching upwards and plenty of power
full outside off, goes hard with the cover drive, mistimes and finds extra cover
beaten. Googly, short of a length and wide outside off. Looks to play the late cut and it's past the edge
yorker length outside off, jammed out to sweeper's left
chipped towards long-off. Looked like he wanted to go leg side there. Full ball outside off, not coming on
full on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover's right
full outside off, gets to the pitch, flicks to long-on
short of a length just outside off, on the back foot to punch to long-on
length on off, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked through midwicket
length on middle, poked uppishly into the leg side
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
short of a length on off stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left off the back foot
misfield! KL Rahul with an embarrassing moment. Full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off's right. He slides on his hip...right past the ball
short of a length at off stump, gets on the back foot and taps through square leg
full on middle stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket's left
full just outside off, driven with the turn to extra cover
googly, short of a length on leg stump. Whipped to square leg off the back foot
short outside off, cut straight to sweeper cover
Ashwin starts with a flat ball down the leg side, goes for a wide
short, outside off, and he cuts this, and Shami misses the ball at point. Perhaps a spot of dew that is affecting the fielders, but there are mistakes now creeping into the Punjab fielding
length, outside off, and he punches towards extra cover
carrom ball, starts on off stump from wide of the crease, and he pushes this towards backward point off the back foot
presses down the crease to meet a good length ball, punches it down to long off
length, outside off, and he goes back to push this towards extra cover
length, and he punches this towards long on, to bring up fifty. Points to the crest on his jersey as he soaks in the applause of the Mohali crowd. This has been a good, controlled innings from him
advances down the wicket to a short ball, and flicks it towards deep midwicket. They pick up two comfortably
length ball, and he pushes this towards the vacant short midwicket area, but Tye is quick to get to the ball this time to prevent any runs being taken
length, down the leg side, and he flicks this away. Fine leg is up inside the circle, and he places this well wide of deep backward square leg

short, and he waits on this and flicks it away towards deep midwicket. They come through for two again, though the return had de Villiers scrambling. It would have been closer, had the throw at the non-striker's end been closer to the bowler
uses his feet to get to a length ball, and punches it down to long off
short, and he punches this towards short midwicket. Tye is first to it
starts with a short ball, and he smacks this towards deep midwicket. Shami slips, but is able to stop the ball from getting to the boundary
length, and he whips this towards deep midwicket. They settle for a single this time
length, and he punches this towards wide long on after moving a bit to get inside the line of that ball
length, on the pads, and he flicks this away, and Gayle dives away to his right at short fine leg. Keeps the scoring down to one!
length, and he gets inside the line of this, and scoops it over short fine leg. One bounce four. More of a swat away, down on one knee!
fuller ball, on the pads, and he flicks this away towards deep midwicket
full ball, on the pads, and he whips this away towards deep midwicket. Played softly enough to require Shami at backward square leg to run diagonally across to his left, and they take two
length, slower ball, and he eases this towards long on
short ball, and he gets up on his toes and whips this towards backward square leg
length, outside off, and he smacks this towards long off
short ball, and Kohli lets this go. Not called a wide, and Kohli remonstrates with the leg umpire. That was short! Should have been a wide
length, jags back into him, and he defends this towards short cover
short, and turning away from AB, who goes back and whips this towards wide long on
full, outside off, and he drives this hard, but cannot beat R Ashwin at short cover
wide, outside off, and he goes back and cuts this towards backward point
flighted, outside off, and he plays this with the turn away towards point
wrong 'un, comes back into AB from outside off, and he plays it watchfully towards long on
flighted, outside off, and he plays a lofted drive, but safely bounces on its way to long off
length ball, straight at the batsman, who punches this down to long on
swift ball, jags into him and he tries to get the whip through midwicket going. It hurries on to him, and he inside-edges this one into his body. They switch ends with some good running

short ball, and he has pulled this straight to M Ashwin! It was fast from Shami, faster off Kohli's bat as he looked for the deep midwicket fence, but M Ashwin was about 10-15 yards inside. Had to hold this over his head, and did well to hang on to what was a bullet shot. Is there a twist in the tale here?
short, and he defends this, off the ground as he plays it towards short midwicket
short again, but a little more outside off, and he backs away and guides this towards third man
full ball, and he drives this down to long on. Examines the bottom of his bat as he runs across to retain strike
carrom ball, that he pushes through to extra cover
carrom ball, from wide of the crease, and Stoinis has to defend this
short, wide, and he cuts this towards backward point. Some work for the man at deep extra cover to do, and they come back for two
length, turns into him, and he punches this to short cover
short, and he punches this through short cover. Misfield from Sarfaraz there, and it allows them to come back for two
length ball, bowled from wide of the crease, and he punches this to long off
full, on his pads, and he flicks this away towards backward square leg. Terrific shot, as it eludes the fielder manning the fine leg boundary
short, and he has cut this one past point. Uses the piece of the ball beautifully to guide it past the man at point! Back to back boundaries

short, and he looks to go across the line. The ball goes high, and M Ashwin has grassed this! It was an ugly across-the-line swipe, and took the top edge and went towards deep midwicket. M Ashwin should have held on to this
short, and AB has whacked this one inside out. Six!
wide, full, and he smacks this towards cover. R Ashwin has hit the stumps straight from there!. But de Villiers is in, and it's also Tye's arm that dislodges the bails
full, wide, and he has smacked this towards extra cover. The man at the fence, Mandeep, has to save this away to his left, and they get a comfortable couple
full ball, and he whips this towards deep midwicket, and they pick up two. Was timed to perfection, in that it made the fielder run in hard
short, and he forces this towards point. Aerial, but safe
length, and he punches this towards short cover
full ball, and he has dropped this down to long off. Interestingly, they kept mid off up for this ball, but Shami missed his mark with what I presume was meant to be a yorker. Critical boundary!
length, and he drags this down to long on
moves across and smashes a length ball over long leg for SIX!
half-tracker, and he goes back and punches this down the ground to long on
short, and he has biffed this away to long off, and they pick up two to complete the victory!
